title.narrative: World Bank Global program on Forced Displacement (GPFD), TF071295, 2016-2018

description.narrative: The World Bank's Global Programme on Forced Displacement (GPFD) was established with Danish support in 2009 with the purpose of advancing World Bank engagement in solutions oriented and longer-term activities in refugee and displacement crises. The programme has delivered persistently better results and has had a significant influence on the World Bank's current engagement as a trend-setting international actor, also in relation to displacement. Over the course of time, the GPFD has evolved forced displacement from a “niche” agenda to a notable mainstream agenda. Through its global leadership efforts and advocacy, rigorous analytical work, strong partnerships, and operational engagement, the GPFD played a critical role in shaping the international community’s response to forced displacement, and putting an agenda so far limited to the margins front and center of the global development scene.
